Dear Clients,

We are writing to inform you about the container ship MSC Elsa 3 (IMO No. 9123221). On May 24, 2025, this Liberian-flagged vessel, which was 28 years old and 184m long, capsized and sank approximately 38 nautical miles southwest of Kochi. The incident occurred while the ship was on its way from Vizhinjam to the port of Cochin.

chunks.text:
We are writing to inform you about the container ship MSC Elsa 3 (IMO No. 9123221). On May 24, 2025, this Liberian-flagged vessel, which was 28 years old and 184m long, capsized and sank approximately 38 nautical miles southwest of Kochi. The incident occurred while the ship was on its way from Vizhinjam to the port of Cochin.

The MSC Elsa 3, carrying 640 containers (13 of which contained hazardous cargo) and over 450 metric tonnes of marine fuel, began listing severely to starboard early on Saturday, issuing a distress call at 08:00 UTC with a reported 26-degree list. The Indian Navy and Coast Guard swiftly responded, rescuing 21 crew members on Saturday and the remaining three early Sunday as conditions deteriorated.

The vessel eventually capsized and sank on Sunday morning, approximately 14.6 nautical miles offshore.

This incident involving containers falling into the Arabian Sea has prompted an environmental response. It's estimated that over 100 containers entered the water, with at least 25 currently adrift. These containers are moving at approximately 3 km/h in the direction of Kerala's coastal districts, specifically Alappuzha, Kollam, Ernakulam, and Thiruvananthapuram.

A few of the containers are known to contain calcium carbide, and coastal communities have been alerted as a precaution. Some containers have already reached the shore, and efforts are underway to confirm the total number.

chunks.text:
A few of the containers are known to contain calcium carbide, and coastal communities have been alerted as a precaution. Some containers have already reached the shore, and efforts are underway to confirm the total number.

Authorities are actively implementing established protocols to manage the situation. The focus is on preventing significant environmental impact, and response efforts are being closely monitored.
 
BARBUSS is aware of this incident and stands ready to assist any parties involved. Our dedicated team of experts specializes in handling claims related to maritime incidents, ensuring a swift and efficient resolution process. Whether it involves damage to cargo, delays, or other unforeseen circumstances, we have the expertise to guide you through the complexities of insurance claims and recovery.

If you've been affected by this incident or need support with maritime claims, please don't hesitate to reach out to our BARBUSS team. We're here to assist you in any way possible and guide you through the claims process.
